commitResults.messageBody:
Fix incorrect format of commented templates.

Templates for the tester response phase's comments on GitHub found in 
the code comments are incorrect. The templates include an extra full 
stop after "Team Chose [ {{ tag }} ]" and "Originally [ {{ tag }} ]" and 
a new line after "**Reason for disagreement:**". 

This causes the issue to be filed under faulty issues when viewed in the 
Tester response phase on CATcher.

Let's fix the formats by removing the extra full stops and replacing the 
new line with a space.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move issue storage logic to mock.github.service.ts (#1317)
commitResults.messageBody:
Move issue storage logic to mock.github.service.ts

The issue service is being mocked, with issues being generated and
stored in mock.issue.service.ts's initialize_data method.

This prevents end to end testing from testing the implementation of
issue.service.ts. This also strays from the structure of CATcher with
issue.service.ts asking for data from github.service.ts.

Let's remove mock.issue.service.ts and move all the mocked issue storage
logic to github.service.ts.

This allows us to test the implementation of issue.service.ts and
results in a testing structure that is more akin to the main
application.

E2e testing is very limited and only covers a small part of the bug
reporting phase.

Let's add more tests, extending it to two more phases - bug trimming
and team response.

Retain github manual edit warning when editing/submitting in tester response phase

Github manual edit warning message disappears after editing/submitting in 
tester response phase.

The warning message should remain in the issue comment to warn testers 
against editing directly their response on GitHub directly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add white-space style to markdown code css (#1295)
commitResults.messageBody:
Add break-space style to the code CSS class of ngx-markdown

When ngx-markdown generates HTML for comments, the browser collapses
whitespace by default, which incorrectly renders code blocks with
extra whitespaces.

To address this, let's add the style `white-space: break-spaces;` to
the code CSS class of ngx-markdown.

This solution aligns with how GitHub styles its markdown code
elements, ensuring that whitespace is preserved and the rendered
output meets user expectations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge feature branch for bug trimming phase to main (#1331)
commitResults.messageBody:
The phases of PE now has an additional bug
trimming phase

CATcher should be updated to include relevant UI
for the new phase to assist students in bug
trimming

Let's,
- Create a new phase called phaseBugTrimming
- Create new table for bug reporting phase to
  allow for deleting and un-deleted of issues
- Add the new table to bug trimming phase
- Create new issue page component that only allows
  editing labels for bug trimming phase
- Issues deleted will have a strike through text
  decoration

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix formatting style of issue-table component
commitResults.messageBody:

* Test update github workflow for playwright

* Add installation of system dependency in github workflow

* Revert changes to test playwright

* Add line break to fix issue table formatting

* Check ubuntu version in github runner

* Use ubuntu-22.04 for playwright

* Revert fixes related to playwright github workflow

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Karma config to fix failing tests on MacOS (#1336)
commitResults.messageBody:
The tests running on MacOS is failing while other
OS are passing, leading to false positive test failures.

Let's fix this issue by updating the karma config
as proposed by the angular community.

commitResults.messageTitle: Upgrade Octokit authentication to fix deprecation warnings (#1344)
commitResults.messageBody:
Upgrade @octokit/rest to v17

@octokit/rest v16 uses a format that will be 
deprecated starting from v17 to construct
an Octokit object, and will cause authentication
request to fail.

Let's upgrade the octokit version to v17
and use the new format so that future upgrades
can happen more smoothly.
